string.text: Hi, Dan! I have some mutant parts for you...
Excellent, Marked One! I have a special need for bundles of three Blind Dog tails, or six Wild Boar hooves. My customers use them to make medicines...
Greetings, Dan. Here are your six boar hooves...
Hi, Dan. I brought those three tails you asked for...
You brought the six hooves? Perfect, I'll get a good price for these!
You've brought me the tails... Well done!!
Unfortunately, I've not collected enough of them yet...
Hello Fox! How are you making out?

These damn dogs have torn my trousers to pieces. They chase me like I've got a backpack full of sausage. Listen, Marked One, can you bring me a parcel from the Duty outpost on the north side of the Dump? Just ask the commander, he's expecting me. It's a good gun that will help keep these dogs from tearing me to bits. And while you're helping me out I'll stay with the Doctor. And don't worry, your reward will be more than adequate...
No problem Fox, I'll help you out. I need to recon that area anyway, be back soon
Bring you what? You want me to risk my life while you sit and get drunk with the Doctor? How thick do you think I am? Go yourself and I will talk with the Doctor
I've brought your gun. It's a very responsive weapon, I really like it. Prapor didn't want to give it to me. He asked to find him some Bloodsucker tentacles first...
Well thanks, Marked One! Sorry for all the trouble. Now that I've got some good fire power those mutants are going to pay!... Here's you reward
Prapor, I'm here to help Fox. He said that you're holding a package for him. He got torn up by some Pseudodogs, so I've to pick it up for him...
Well what do you think this is, a post office? If you want it, your going to have to earn it! Bring me a pair of Bloodsucker tentacles, then you can have the parcel. For storage fees, so to speak
Well looks like you mean business... all right I will bring them, if I survive. I don't think Fox will live much longer without a better weapon and I made a promise
So, Prapor, about my health... don't ask. Here are your tentacles. It was hard to get them. Where's the parcel?

Thank you, Marked One! Well you're not a rookie after all. These tentacles are necessary for my health, strong medicine can be made from them. Yes my troubles have ended. To be honest we had a wager on whether you would return or not. I lost 5 bottles of Vodka in that bet... HA!
Looks like I need your help
All eventually need my help. All the Zone uses my information
General Voronin sent me... He says you know who killed Fang, and why...

Marked One, you've become a respected man in the Zone, but why does everyone think they can approach me and demand I share my information free of charge? Information is how I make my living, and if you want it you'll need to pay! However, I have lately been told that someone has stolen the PDA of Tirana, the leader of the Mercenaries, and he is, to put it mildly, somewhat upset. In the same way that a herd of stampeding buffalo is somewhat upset. I hope you understand how valuable this information is, and how much it's worth. Many are hunting for this PDA - Duty, Freedom, and even Bandits are all trying to find it before the others do. Well, I know who has it and where this person is. If you'll agree to bring it to me, I'll point you towards the one you need, and he'll tell you everything he knows. And I believe he knows a lot...
Okay, we'll do it your way. Where's this guy with the PDA?
In the Swamps there's a new trader. His name's Dan. My sources tell me that he is somehow connected with this business, and most likely has the PDA...
That's all I need to know. I'll find him...
I'm back in one piece, and here's the PDA. Listen, Mercenaries seem to know too much about where and when I'll be somewhere. I just foiled another ambush. Did you try to set me up?

This is excellent, and well done! You're a man of his word! Mercenaries you say? Every faction is hunting for this PDA. At one time or another the Military, Freedom, Duty, and even those egghead scientists at Yantar have used their services to get their dirty work done without tarnishing their image. Listen to me carefully. I've got the information you need. In the Army Warehouses, at the base of Freedom, in one of the barracks, you will find LeHavre. He's also known as 'the Frenchman'. He's the one who'll answer your questions about Fang...
Are you serious? A Mercenary at Freedom's base! Has the world gone mad, or am I missing something?

Not so loud... You don't know this man LeHavre. He has connections with many powerful and evil people. Freedom receives prototypes of new weapons through his suppliers, so they turn a blind eye and let him do business at their base. It works out well for both of them, But LeHavre is a very experienced and dangerous man. He knows all the wrong people, so always be on your guard, and good luck to you... By the way, take this artefact. It's quite a good one...
Dan, I'm looking for a PDA belonging to a guy named Tirana. I'm told you can help...
Sure, I have it here. It's of no use to me. I just hope you can use it...
If you ever see the little bastard who gave me that PDA to look after, tell him he almost got me killed...
Thanks, Dan. You're a gentleman...
No problem, Marked One. Good luck to you...
Are you LeHavre? Snitch sent me to find you...

Ah, so you're the Marked One! Snitch tells me that you search for the murderer of Fang. I can help but it's necessary for you to do some jobs for us, which I will pay you for. Then I'll tell you what you want to know...
Seems I'm making a deal with the devil... So what do you have in mind?

Stalker, try to understand. If you want to learn the secrets of the dead, you'll do what's necessary... You brought a PDA to the informant, and from the data recovered we found that in our well-disposed ranks is a rat. But it's not so simple, because it's one of our leaders. We don't have enough direct evidence, so I can't kill him myself. That would lead to reprisals, and a possible clan war. But you, as a freelancer, could kill this man without consequence to us. The rat's name is Bolt, and he's close by - at the end of the road that leads to this base. If you can get his PDA, I'll have proof of his participation in the theft of Tirana's PDA. If you're okay with this, there's a good reward in it for you...
Alright, I'll bring you the PDA. What choice do I have?
Hey! You could have given me an idea of what I was walking into! Here, take it!

I find it insulting, listening to your vulgar mouth. I'm an educated man with a sensitive personality. You must know by now that the Zone is full of unexpected trouble. Look, here's a five-copeck coin for some vodka to sooth your nerves...
Wow! Is it Gordon Freeman? How did you get here? I heard you'd been killed, or at least that you had a price on your head...

Yes, I needed to disappear before someone organized it for me, so I made my way into the Zone. In the Cordon I hired a guide from a man named Sidorovich. He took me through a valley, past a lake, and into a factory complex before he started to mumble. I saw that something was wrong with his focusing, and I tried to talk to him, but he didn't respond. His eyes looked glazed and empty, and I feared he was turning into a zombie.
Then I heard the roar of a mutant and was scared for our lives. I saw a tunnel full of Electro anomalies close by, but I'm more scared of mutants so I worked my way to the end of it and found a quiet place to sleep. My head was hurting badly, but if you're tired enough you can sleep through anything...
I don't know how long I was there - A week? A month? I don't remember. I was woken up by a screech more terrible than I've ever heard before. It was a huge mutant, stood in the middle of an Electro, and seemed to be charging up in it...
I tried to move around quietly, but it sensed me and began to growl. Without bolts, without a detector, I just ran and didn't stop until I found refuge here
I left all my gear in that tunnel, including my Desert Eagle chambered for the more common 9x39 cartridge. It's a powerful weapon, and I've used it to kill a pair of Bloodsuckers with one mag. Truth is, though, I'm afraid to go back there. If you're in that area would you search for this gun? Return my weapons to me and I'll happily give you one of them...
Don't worry, Freeman. I'm going that way, and I'll find your gun...
Hey, Gordon! Here's your Desert Eagle...
Marked One, I am happy to call you my friend. Here, please accept this artefact I promised...
Thank you. Are you enjoying the Barman's company? He's quite a character...

Yes, he's good company and can drink like a fish. Marked One, I've got more serious business I need your help with. When travelling with my guide and reaching the Wild Territory, I met a man. His name is DeJames, who claimed to be from America also. He offered me a lot of vodka, then persuaded me to give him my document case for safekeeping. There are some important documents inside that I could really use here. I need that case, but I fear the guy is a conman. He's currently staying in a small carriage in the Wild Territory. Are you able to visit him and collect it on my behalf?
Yes, sure. What was his name, DeJames? Not a local man, that's for sure. I'll go carefully...
DeJames, Freeman asks if he may have his case back...
His case? No, he gave it to me. Now fuck off before my boys take offence...
I didn't come here for trouble. But I'm not leaving without the case...
Fuck you!
Freeman, you were right. Your friend DeJames conned you...
Why? What happened?
He was a mercenary. He recognized you, and wanted your case all along. He and his gang attacked me. But they won't be conning anyone else. Here's your case...
I'm sorry, Marked One. I didn't think he was that bad. Here take this, I hope it compensates you for any injury you've suffered
Well LeHavre, what's next?

Marked One, onto the next order of business. One of the Monolithians was supposed to extract documents and deliver them to us. However communication with him has broken down, he doesn't answer his PDA. The last message we received from him came from the Radar. During an emission we think he took cover in Lab X-10. Your problem - to find him and to take the documents. We know that you have received a helmet which protects you from Psi-radiation from the scientists
I Doubt an emission has the same effect on a Monolithian. Alright LeHavre, I will look for the guy
I found your Monolithian. Only he is dead, and not just the Monolithian, also a lab full of mutants. Here take your documents
So, the Marked One performs under pressure. A real professional! Well here, take a well-deserved reward
Freeman, we need to talk...
Go ahead, Marked One...

As soon as I started investigating my friend, Fang's, death, Mercenaries started to appear. I don't trust LeHavre, but he sent me to Bolt, who tried to kill me. And there've been foreign mercenaries after me constantly. I don't know what the hell's going on, but I made a copy of the document I found for LeHavre. Does it make any sense to you?

Marked One, I am on the task. So... Interesting... All! I, apparently, have understood, who and what for Fang was killed. But I do not have enough information. Listen, Marked One, such business, in papers that you have brought in my case, there were for some documents of DeJames. And so in them it is told about a super confidential meeting of leaders of the Mercenaries. The meeting as I have understood, should occur somewhere in the Dark Valley. And so, at this meeting there will be a certain Bland. He should have an important flash card, you need to descend there and to take away this flash card. Also hurry, Marked One, soon other leaders will arrive and there will be no place there to spit at for protection
I'll find this Bland, and get the drive. I need to put my friend to rest...
Here's the flash drive from Bland...

Give it here and I will examine it. Well here... as I thought. In general, Marked One, business such. One of the gangs of Mercenaries which basically consists of foreigners, has decided to grasp the Monolith. For what I do not know, but hardly for something good. Fang was employed to work alone. Simply it was one of those not many who made campaigns in the Zone center. Such person was necessary to Mercenaries and consequently they have suggested it to work on them, having told that orders arrive from various scientific research institutes. And you know that Fang was clever with electronics and helped the scientists in Yantar. But in due course Fang has scented wrong and has started to dig. They have discovered it and have ordered the hit. Who do you think gave the order?... LeHavre! He must be the main co-ordinator of this organization in the Zone. Without these documents nobody solves anything. By the way here to you a gift from me
Thanks, Freeman, I suspected that LeHavre of a bough, but now I am assured of it. All right. I will go, good riddance to that bum!
Good luck, Marked One. Be more careful
How's life treating you these days... Freeman?
Same as usual... here now, there later... you know how it is
Life can be a little warped now and then, can't it... well... hope you're around for awhile, eh!
Well, the Chap, has learnt me? You know, what for I have come?
Slow down man... let us have a drink... I have some nice Cognac here... Our base in the Dark Valley recently - was that your work?
Yes I have no place to hurry up especially, give. Yes base - my work. And your six of Bland I too enjoy. But now I have exact proof of your fault. For who has killed my friend Fang?

It worked any time for us in dark, thinking that works on scientists. We to it well paid, to begin with even gave it tasks on more harmless, type bring an artefact, remove gauging. Though an overall objective always was - the Monolith. We searched for possible ways of pass to the Monolith, and you, that is Streloks, and Fang - one of the few who there happened and knew as there to get. But, probably, he began to suspect us, has started to dig, and has then tried to disappear. We were afraid that it, can merge the information on us to somebody and consequently I have personally made the decision on Fang liquidation. The sniper waited for it in village of Bloodsuckers. Further you know
Lines that that is stuffy. I have found the murderer, it is time to the Miner... About what it I? Ah you of a bough... You... You have poisoned me. Vile selling death, well...
Have a rest my friend
Aaa... My head. I should go to the Miner... Where it I? And, I see, well you and... What it, what it was?
It only soporific, do not worry you while to me live it is necessary, well has had a rest? Yes spit you on Fang, about itself see to it better

Spit you speak? Here so to take and forget that was? Say Fang, you certainly the guy good, we with you have together worried so much, but now I and about myself should see to it'. So you offer? And so know - Strelok does not betray
Can we do some trading? Parts of mutants, for cartridges and artefacts?
Basically I can. But first, I need you to bring me forty military PDAs. Then we'll talk...
Alright, I'll go and search for the PDAs. Ammo and artefacts for mutant parts sounds like a good deal...
Dan, I have some work for you. I need something repaired...
Lets take a look at what you have there
Repair the first weapon
Repair the second weapon
Repair the outfit
YO eat, well at you and the price to be stunned! Yes well this repair in a bath so I resemble!
Hold, all works as it is necessary!
Catch. All that is necessary, is made!
You certainly know your way around such things. It's perfect!!
Yes, you do good work... Well worth the money!!
Can you repair something else?
Certainly I can, at me clients while it is small.\n \nthe List of possible repairs:
Well, Dan. None of these military guys parted with their PDAs easily, but here you go...
Nice work, Marked One. Now I know I can trust you, we can trade in a larger variety of mutant parts...
Dan, what will you take in trade?

No one in the Zone trades in mutant parts on my level. These eyes, hands, feet, and tails are useless to most Stalkers, even Sidorovich! The nearest place you can get anything for them is the Dump, with the Stalker known as Raven, and he only wants tails. If you're just looking for cash, the scientist in the bunker on Lake Yantar researches mutant parts from all corners of the Zone. He pays a decent price, too, and we do a lot of business with him. By all means check with Raven and see what he'll give you, but here's what I offer: For three Flesh eyes, I'll give you three packs of 9x19mm armor-piercing cartridges. For five Tushkano heads, three packs of 11.43x23 armor-piercing. For four Controller hands, five packs of 5.45mm armor-piercing...
Greetings, Dan. What's that song? 'I only have eyes for you...'
Greetings, Dan. I have those Tushkano heads you wanted...
Shit, I've still got that fucking mutant noise in my head! I need more ammo...
Hold cartridges, you can not recalculate - all precisely
About, has brought, the good fellow, just the client on them is available for me

Is not present, the brother, itself you understand, cartridges now in the price, especially armor-piercing! Except me, here only fighters trade in them, so take how many agreed, well and here to you, the gift - to steam of small bottles darling - to sit, relax, while trousers will dry, brains a little to clean
Sounds good to me, Dan. Ammo's scarce. Mutants aren't...
Hi, Dan. What's on your mind?

Marked One, listen. I've just received a tipoff that scientists have brought something unusual to the Agroprom military base. I don't know what it is, but with the security detail they had, it's got to be a top secret project. I've got a team there keeping it under observation, but with your skills and, er, obvious dislike of the military, I thought maybe you'd like to find out more...
Are you sure this isn't a setup? Drawing attention to one area while they get the job done quietly at another?

Yes, the thought had occurred to me, but this is an experienced group of veterans led by one of the best. Arhara is his name, and he's heard of you. Said he'd be honored to have you with them on the incursion. Arhara was once a member of Freedom, but had some serious disagreements with Lukash about their direction. He left as an 'Independant', and a group of Freedom's best fighters left with him. That's how good he is...
Okay, I'll go and meet Arhara, and see if what you say is true...
Hi. Are you Arhara?

Yes, and you must be Marked One! I've been looking forward to meeting and working with you... Here's what we plan to do - we'll go through the southern gate and put down some resistance in the compound. When you hear the shooting you get into the main complex and obtain a package from the scientists. It's highly unlikely they'll put up any resistance, and the head scientist Ivaschenko will probably have it on him...

The plan sounds fine, with plenty of flexibility. It's good to meet some decent fighters willing to share the risk, and I'm honored you trust me with the important part. If your guys are ready, then let's go...
Dan, it was there. Here I brought this helmet
This is interesting, your a fine fellow Marked One. Here's your reward. I will examine this for awhile and we will speak later. Yes, Arhara asked if you would come and see him about some business
Hello Arhara, Dan said you wanted to talk to me?

One of my men went into the Agroprom underground two days ago and has not returned. You know from experience that the place is full of evil spirits, bandits, mutants, and even soldiers. He had a notebook of mine that I wouldn't want to fall into the wrong hands. Will you find him and bring back the notebook?
Why don't you send one of your own fighters?

There are only a few of us left now, so I can't take the risk. Bandits and mutants grow in numbers, every man with a weapon is important. You, as I saw for myself, are a master. You know the catacombs better than any Stalker. The men have donated cartridges to give to you
I will find your notebook, cartridges I always need
How's the situation now?
My fighters are under too much pressure holding this complex. We may need to leave here. Do you have the notebook?
Yes, here you are. Your man is dead, I believe he ran into an Electro anomaly while trying to escape the Controllers
Thanks Marked One, we are lucky to have you as a friend. Controllers you say? then it really is necessary to change location
Arhara, is there anything else?

Marked One, there is another task on the Radar. In the red wood, near a helicopter, lies a backpack and nearby a foot locker. Take away anything you find there as an award. The most important thing at the crash site is my laptop, it contains important data! I need you to find it and bring to my brother Yakut
Arhara, the Psi-radiation will kill me before I even get close to the crash site. Also, where would I find your brother Yakut?
Marked One, remember the helmet you took to Dan? It will help you, with it you can pass through Psi-radiation
Alright, I will go speak to Dan, but I have my doubts about this helmet...
don't worry brother, I speak the truth. You will find Yakut in the Army Warehouses. He is camped with a group of Stalkers, their leader is called Wolf
Are you Yakut? I have brought you the laptop
Marked One! Long live your mother! My brother will be happy you found the laptop and that you returned safely. Arhara praised you, says your a professional
I'm glad its over, too many Anomalies and doggies...
Dan, have you learned anything about the helmet?

Yes, its almost adjusted, but I'm missing some information. Listen, have you gathered info from laboratory X-18? There's some data in this laboratory about the influence of Psi-waves on the human brain. For certain they have more detailed information on this phenomenon. Bring to me the information from there or a flash card with the data. With this info I could adjust it quickly
I will go to the lab and look for the flash card for you. I can't go to the Radar without a working helmet
Greetings Dan, here's the flash card

Well, let me take a look. Aha... So... that's what's necessary. Marked One, Wait while I adjust the helmet and I will give it to you... The helmet is adjusted and should protect you from Psi-radiation. Here you are, good luck Marked One
What's on your mind?

Listen, Marked One, about that corpse you found in the lab. Could you tell if it was really the body of Ghost? I have doubts that Ghost was lost. I don't think a professional like Ghost would have fallen to a controller. I will tell you something that very few people know, Ghost didn't come here alone. The Stalker that was with him was almost a look-alike. We continually confused them. You after all hardly remember what Ghost looked like. Do you think its really his corpse in the lab!?
It could be someone else, what else leads you to suspect its not him?

Before Vasilyev, and Ghost went into the Laboratory, we shared a small bottle the prior evening. We talked about the Zone, about the Monolith, but Ghost was mostly silent that evening. He had a look in his eyes, like a predator. He did say that all surviving members of Strelok's Group were being hunted down... He said he came to Yantar for the solitude, as there remains but only a few people here. Too many Zombies, and Snorks to look out for. I asked Ghost if they were brothers, he told me that they had got acquainted recently at the Bar. You know what I think?, he wanted to make it look like he was dead. And there lies the other loner, not Ghost. Now everyone thinks that he is dead, and that makes it easier for him to hide
Well, you could be right. Do you have any idea where he might hide?

Listen, Marked One, I have co-ordinates of a cache in Agroprom. I will send the location to your PDA. Ghost gave me these co-ordinates in case he didn't make it back. Marked One, go there and see if you can find some information on where he might be hiding
Agroprom? I will go and see if I can find something

Greetings, I have found it, there the diary was. Lying on the ground and its in poor condition so to read written text is difficult enough. The only thing, here, in one place about a person is written... 'You will find it in the Warehouses, near the base of Freedom'
Give it to me, the truth may lie within. Listen, Marked One, you should go to the Bar in Rostok and ask around, I will look over the diary, if I can read any more of it
It is fine, and most in the Bar it is necessary to me, to Barman business is, besides to buy something it would be advisable. I hope you can understand that
Greetings, Barman, have questions...
Ask certainly, to you I will tell all that I know
Listen, you did not see Ghost? Speak, he was here

Such business, Marked One, somewhere with one month ago or more, he was in the Bar and came to me, in general conversation concerns only me and Ghost, but... In general, he asked to find a 'master key', so to say with certain appearance
Barman, do not muddle, I know about the 'master key'... similar to Ghost! Further...
Marked One, you understand, I am a businessman, and the information, like as, too the goods. Give so, bring to me one artefact of Simbion and I will tell you everything that I know
You are more of a 'Pusher' than a Businessman... Fine!! I will go, and have a look...
Well 'businessman', I have brought you a Simbion

Marked One, you, as always, please! It is pleasant to deal with you! In general listen, yes, he asked me to find the person more or less similar to it. A problem the extremely difficult, appearance at Ghost picturesque so I and itself did not hope that I can find, but day through two after ours with it of conversation, Duty have caught the music, is not far from the Southern outpost, it somehow painfully suspiciously conducted itself(himself), as subsequently it has appeared, he did not eat three days it, spoke that the Bloodsucker has attacked it also it, escaping, all things has lost also a miracle he has reached the Bar. I in general, all the same, am said lies by it or not. The main thing that it as two drops is similar on Ghost. Well I have fed him, have given out which what need. Ghost Here has come, they about something have talked and have fallen down towards Yantar. Everything, is more I that, another did not see. And then I was reached by the information that Ghost has left in a lab and... Has not returned. Yes he asked, that I spoke to nobody, about a 'master key' so I hope, it remains between us. Yes has absolutely forgotten. Scientists asked you to come to Yantar, they have business for you
You know, I not from the Talkative. Oh these scientists, time to them you will help will not lag behind, but all the same, thanks
Well, could read something?

Marked One, such business, in General I try to restore make-shifts of a diary but if it is fair, results yet not impressing. Listen, you could not help us? We have departed to last emission protection. We have somehow repaired it, but it all the same works through time. We have ordered to ourselves new. But the helicopter is not present some days, on visible because of last emissions, to us on Yantar it is very difficult to reach by air. And we without the computer as without hands. And I would decipher Ghost diary faster
I need a Computer System... can you help me find one?!
There is one person, Arhara, he as offered that to us, but then it was not necessary for us also we have refused
Well it is fine, I will try to find for Arhara...
Hello, Arhara, was here at Scientists, speak at you is protection?
Hello, Marked One, was yes Sly, I to its Duty have sold. So is not present it is more
To me that what to do? Where I protection will get?
Well in general there is one place, laboratory X-18, there should be precisely
Again to a Burer on a visit to go? Well they do not differ hospitality. I all right will go, have put much. Good luck
Hello, here protection, yes it was necessary to run about. I hope knowingly

Oh, Marked One, well you have gained us. And that to us have informed that the helicopter will be only in three days, and we has definitively departed. Look I the Yakut could read a name '... At... Warehouses'. Who it would be? Yes, here to you for the help, take cartridges for sniper
Yakut? I know Yakut... I'll go and have a chat with him...
Good to see you, Yakut. You're looking well. Tell me, did you know a guy called Ghost?
Well, I knew a guy once. A good Stalker, but I heard he died in X-16...
Yes, he did. Only some think he didn't...
So I've also heard. And that he was a member of Strelok's group. And they had a den in the Agroprom underground. So if he's still alive, mightn't he have gone back there?

Agroprom Underground? Interesting. What safer place to hide than a nest of Bloodsuckers and Bandits? Only a madman or an idiot would hide there, and Ghost was neither. But thanks, I'll check out what's down there...
Well, Ghost wasn't there, but I did meet a lot of people who went out of their way to conceal their identity. It was definitely an ambush...

Well, it's clear that you don't believe he died, which probably makes you a dangerous guy to be around. Look, I've also heard stories about Radar. You know where the entrance to X-10 is? Try there. It's certainly a good place to hide, but if I'm wrong then, sorry, that's all I know..
Radar? Last time I was there it was full of corpses. Some of them still moving. I'll check it out...
The same old Ghost. You fooled everyone...

It's wonderful to see you again, my friend! After we got separated, I thought you also gone forever. But when I started hearing stories of this 'Marked One', I knew I had to find out more! You always were the best amongst us, but please understand that I couldn't make myself known to you until I was sure. I learned that from you...

I'm sorry. When I returned I couldn't remember anything but the occasional flashback. Although I bumped into some of our old friends, they were all careful and said nothing. But they looked after me in the background and guided me carefully. One came down to the Cordon to see me, another waited for me at Agroprom... You know, the more I learn, the more I realise how lucky I am to have such friends... I have so many questions, but I know we have work to do, and we need to get you sorted out. Just tell how you got out of that laboratory, with the Brain Scorcher running?

You already know my story. The three of us went to the Lab - me, Vasiliev, and my new 'friend' Jimmy. I didn't know if we could turn off the Scorcher or not, but my main reason for going was to trick those who wanted me dead - him included. You heard about my 'doppelganger' then? I still feel sorry for the guy, but there was nothing I could do for him. He didn't believe that you were dead, and would have kept coming for you. I knew you'd be alive, but no one had heard anything from you, and there was no place in the Zone where I felt safe. So it was only after the body-in-the-lab stunt that I was finally able to start searching for news...
Through some of his people I learned that you were around, but had lost your memory. You probably know by now of the group calling themselves Avengers? Well, they're not. They're just cold-blooded Mercenaries who'll kill anyone to order. But there's something else. I've heard these so-called Avengers are run by people from the Last Day faction, who are just another bunch of fucking murderers...
Hey, did you know that when I was young, I got into a fight with their leader, and beat him? Well, it seems that he and his friends got together again and now he wants to destroy me, for as long and as painfully as possible... But they're bloody good at what they do. I don't know how they got trained, or where they got their equipment, but no faction wants to get in their way, not even Monolith. The guy who wants me is called Beast. He named himself, as I understand it. If he's eliminated, then they'll either fall apart or regroup with a new leader. Either way there's a good chance I'll be left alone...
My boys recently told me that Beast and Oblique, his right-hand man, have organized a group of men in the Swamps, at an old farm on the outskirts. They're turning it into a base, one of many they're planning around the Zone. I've already sent some fighters there, along with someone else you'll recognize, but they're either too young or too old, and they could use your experience. Can you go and help them? We don't just want to kill Beast, to stop what they're planning, but there's a flash drive with a list of all their victims, past and present. We need that. Now here... is a rough location of where our guys are in the Swamps...
Ghost, your war is my war, your enemy my enemy. Whatever you need, I will be by your side. And yes, I've met some of these 'Avengers', but they're no superheroes...

I'm sorry, but Beast wasn't there. Oblique had his flash drive though, and you were right about it. There's an outstanding hit list, and a list of everyone killed to date. Hey, you're going to like this - I'm on the first list. You're on the second!

So the gutless bastard ran away... Well, I'm very grateful for the flash drive. Here, please take my personal Gauss rifle. I found it near the Zone's center. It'd been in an Electro anomaly long enough to become a supergun, and its fire rate has increased several times over. I'd like you to have it. Also check your PDA - I entered a waypoint for my special stash, which includes my personal tactical outfit...
Well, do we know where this invertebrate 'beast' is?

Yes, we do now. He'll want to surrender to the authorities, then swap his secrets for a safe way out of the Zone. He'll be at the Cordon, talking to the military at their outpost. They take protection there very seriously, so you can't go in alone. There'll be a small group of men waiting for you nearby. Children of veterans, all skilled, and many with scores to settle, so don't refuse their help. Beast should have a list of all his clients. Find that, and we can finish this off...
Don't worry. We'll get him...
Beast is dead, my friend. I made doubly sure. And here's his client list...
Strelok, you honour me as a friend. I wish I had more than these sniper cartridges to offer you. Well, my brother, I know that the Monolith awaits you. Good luck, and may we meet again soon...

Hello Yakut, the trouble has happened with me, I here have squabbled with LeHavre. So he has poisoned me in my opinion. A head till now the pig-iron. Yes has drunk brandy. Well so has regained consciousness, they probably have not noticed that I am drunk. Has looked round on fast in pockets, money is gone. Somehow with them has understood, then the Nectar of the Gods, and the things that are not present. Where they have got to? In the same place the base of freedom, turns out except scientists and to take not to whom?

I here on affairs went, to children on base so saw as steam of Mercenaries carrying one hundred kilo backpacks, no less. They not through gate went, and the hole there is in a corner in a fence. As they bore it, for me till now a riddle. It is to any person not under force. And so wanted nuts on them, yes was not in time, it is sick quickly they skedaddle. And I think, what to me business to them, not mine, and figs with it. Now it is clear that they bore. Listen, descend here parking of Mercenaries at once behind village with Bloodsuckers. There the base at them, can there the Bloodsuckers and will find. At the same time business good you will make, painfully to play pranks they lately became, a lot of our brothers of the Stalker from their hands was lost. Here and so mutants flight from the center a rod so also they devils get the habit a robbery to be engaged. Yes it would be necessary to Lukash to tell that for affairs, it is direct not base, and a double-exit courtyard, Mercenaries as at home go. Though that from these scientists to take, as evening, so half of protection drunk, and the second smoked
Well I to these devils that will set brains. Wait, I will return soon

Yakut Is healthy, I have taken away here Bloodsuckers, but they in a box lie, and it with the lock code. Can you open? Yeah, and - senior to those thugs was clearly not a Mercenary - he of the clan Last Day
Wait, aha here hold. Last Day? You're not wrong hour? that group are gone. Maybe someone from Mercenaries pretending
Also it is all? I here the Zone floor stand, on me any one hundred corpses, Bloodsuckers the party bypass me, wild boars all legless go, and dogs without tails. Where? Where all mine of loots?
Yes calm down you, Marked One, you has killed all of them from whom now you will ask? But now with empty pockets directly to a Monolith
Owl? Wow, I was hoping it'd be you! Is everything ready?

Hello again, my friend. Yes, there are at least ten of Beast's men down there, and many are almost invisible\nStrelok, I fear that this may be my last fight. Ghost taught me to listen to my intuition, and in the Zone instinct is more reliable than any detector. I'm not afraid. I'd do anything for Ghost. He saved my life three times, for God's sake! I'm glad he's not here, because he'd ask me to oversee everything from a vantage point. But I want to repay him. I just wanted you to know...
Owl, you're talking shit, as always. I'm here now, so help us out and watch if anyone escapes. Later we'll drink together, and catch up on old times, okay? Let's do this...
Ghost! Is it really you?
Hello, my dear friend. It's been a long time, and I didn't know if I could trust you. Owl gave me your note. I'd read it often, and each time it brought me to tears. Now, I can return it to you...
Hello, Musics, Ghost has sent me, how are conditions?
Yes all a way, protection truth too much, but, I think, we will consult
Well it is good to smoke, we are put forward yes on the parties look, something to me not on myself somehow, painfully easy
Hello Professor.I need a helmet adjusted, please...
You need this helmet adjusted against Psi-radiation? Where did you get it?
I received it from Dan in the Swamps...

Well, this one is interesting, no doubt, but we've been dealing with this problem for a long time, and have already developed helmets that will protect you better than this one. We need to make one last measurement, then I'll give you a helmet adjusted by us, which will allow you to get through to Chernobyl. Are you happy to do a swap?
No problem, Professor. Here you go...
Sorry, Professor, I haven't got it with me...
Thanks. Take this as a gift from me...
Yakut, I'd like to talk to you...
Forgive, Marked One, I is now occupied. Freeman asked to come to it. Speaks affairs much, and Marked One of lines knows where goes, idles
Greetings. You Zahar? There is a job?
Marked One, is one business, of risk are not afraid?
That, Zahar, has desired to joke? We here risk every minute, so one risk more... Do not pull tell

Business not simple, but very important for us. My main assistant Dan from bogs has sent me the extracted trophies. For you, as well as for many, they do not represent interest are parts of mutants, and for us - a way to survive. Deliver them owe three hunters. They have stopped on rest at abandoned factory in Cordon, as while under the bridge where a post of military men cannot take place. There are data from Akim that on my people to prepare the attack. I have warned them, but it is not known, how many will be marauders... Has contacted Bes - that says that all its people are occupied - with bandits there is a territory repartition on Marshes. You the soldier skilled - will not help? You will find the senior - Sepator - he will explain all. If it agree - a gift for me
All right I descend on a cordon, I will help children
Greetings. I from Zahar, to you in help

While all is silent, but not to be pleasant to me it. You, I see, have managed to pass under the bridge. What not to risk, if we will be in time - we will make so: we will go back on bogs, and you - take away a bag and Zahar transfer. I threw it onto a roof for safety. And for your service - take while my hunting bow with a fitted night vision device and arrows. They may come in useful...
It is good. I do not love superfluous blood. To bogs, I hope, will gather additionally. Here lines, in my opinion, we were late - visitors have appeared. Well, keep, musics...
Uff... Was hot...

Also do not speak... The skill of the hunter was useful... Thanks that has helped. Take the bag from a roof and take the contents to Zahar, but not to lose any! Tell to it that all is Okay, and I to Sidorovich on the way will come, I will smoke, yes to myself - on bogs I will go
Frets. I hope, still we will see. To smoke, by the way, harmfully. Though, it is better to smoke, than to breath our poisoned air. On ecology all nasal... only on the summits confused go...
Greetings, Zahar. Here - the contents of that filthy bag...
Here thanks! I hope Sepator is live?
Yes, safe and sound. Where he will get to
Has gained us fine, here take for work
Thanks, class Art!
Is not present, it was lost... Was marauders Too much...
It is a pity... The good Music was... Means, with protection it has not turned out. Well only one - the bag with parts of mutants is whole. Here, take - can be useful...
Thanks...
Here lines... In turmoil I at all have not looked, whether it is live...
If it is live - that you should talk over with it, and after and we will communicate to you...
Has understood
Hello brother. Who are you?
I'm Dan, of the 'Hunter' faction. We've organised small base here, where we buy up Stalkers' artefacts and mutant parts
Do you trade your goods with the bar?
We sell our mutant parts to Sakharov in Yantar, as the Bar doesn't pay a good price. You should talk with Zahar - he has set up our main base close to the Bar
Zahar, do you buy artefacts?

We buy up Artefacts for the scientists. Currently we buy 'Crystal' and 'Meat Chunk' artefacts. For three Crystals we will give you an Absolute Artefact, for three Meat Chunks we will give you a modified weapon. For one 'Gravi' you will receive three Antirads. Okay?
Zahar, I have three Crystals for you
I have found three Meat Chunks, saved especially for you
I need some Antirads. Here's a Gravi
Sakharov will be happy to see three Crystals

string_table.string: You always surprise me, how do you manage to find so many Artefacts? My blockheads only find Stone Bloods or nothing. Nothing this time?!-- Small edits - Sword2012 - 31 Oct 16-->

string.text: Gravi? here take some Antirad
This time my backpack is empty
Zahar, what's wrong?

Until recently, we once a week sent Artefacts to the scientists in Yantar. A group of Mercenaries has been ambushing my men trying to make these deliveries in the Wild Territory. Can you get rid of these Mercs?
Zahar, these are your problems, why should I get involved?

Marked One, you know my men are not good fighters. I'm afraid if we try to do it ourselves, my men will be wiped out. I went to Voronin and asked for help, but as always he answered: I can't spare the manpower. Help us re-establish a route to the Scientists
I will help you Zahar, I don't want to see you go out of business
Zahar greetings, the pass is free of Mercs now
You're a fine fellow, at last we can trade with the Scientists directly
Zahar, you should organise an advanced post in the Wild Territory, so they don't return again
Yes that's good advice, here's your reward
Well Prapor how's the service life?
Marked One, we caught a bandit trying to sneak through yesterday. We found a broken PDA in his backpack...
What's that got to do with me?
Well you're the kind of person who likes to stick his nose into other people's affairs. It's yours if you bring me some scientific medkits
How many?
Can you get me twenty, or is that too much to ask? Okay, I'll settle for ten...
Well you ask a big price for a PDA that doesn't work, 10 scientific medkits? Well alright I will bring
Well Prapor I have brought the medkits

Thanks Marked One, these are for my men. Voronin or the Miser, doesn't supply us with these. I need to take care of my guys, you understand?. Here take the PDA, go to the Barman. He has two egg-heads in the back who can repair anything
Greetings Barman, who can repair this PDA?
Yes I can arrange that, but you understand I need a favor first. Bring me a 'Chimera Tears' artefact. Zahar ordered one from me almost a month ago...
A Chimera Tears for repairing a PDA? No way! I'll get you a 'Fire Tears' and you can cook it yourself...
Hey, Marked One, don't get upset! Give me a Fire Tears and we have a deal...
Okay, I'll leave it with you. In the meantime I'll find you a Fire Tears...
I've found you a Fire Tears. Here...
Marked One, don't get angry. Lanky had a birthday party and too much vodka was involved. Your PDA was on his bench, and ended up getting smashed to bits...
Is this a joke? There might be people in trouble or someone needing help! And your drunks destroy the information?
Marked One, I understand the guys did something stupid, and I gave them a royal bollocking... But there's nothing more I can do, other than offering you a case of vodka as indemnification...
I know there's nothing you can do, but that doesn't mean I'm not fucking angry! This has been such a waste... Look, just give me time to calm down, okay?
Professor, I need to talk to you...
Yes, Marked One, I'm listening
Recently I found a military man's corpse. On it was a note. It mentioned an expedition to the Brain Scorcher...

Marked One, I shouldn't even be telling you this. Several months ago a group of scientists, with support from above, obtained a permit to search Lab X-10 at Radar. I tried every possible way to stop them, explaining that the territory was understudied, and that their chances of reaching the lab alive were very slim indeed. I suggested that we first complete the study of Lab X-16, to better understand how quickly Psi radiation affects the brain, and design counter-measures. But they wouldn't listen to me. Now weeks have passed, and nothing has been heard from them. I'm inclined to think the worst...

This is strange, Professor, when I went to disconnect the Brain Scorcher I didn't find any group there, and saw no trace of these people. Well, there were Monolithians, but they're fanatics, not people any more...
Its possible you didn't investigate all the bunker, for certain during that moment you had more important affairs. Don't you think that it's necessary for you to visit there once again?
Likely you are right, Professor. To understand what happened there, I should go and explore it once again
Professor, I need to talk with you...

Keep your voice down, Marked One. If it's about what I think, you need to talk with someone who's very familiar with the Brain Scorcher. You also need to know that there are many bad people here in the Zone, and some of them work for those who are even more dangerous. I've only heard rumours, but... we're scientists, not soldiers... You'll need to infiltrate a mercenary group at the Army warehouses. I can't say any more about this until it's safe to do so....
Hello. You don't look good. Take this medkit...

Thank you, young man... coughs blood... Forgive I do not know what is your name, but I am afraid... coughs blood... I'm afraid it will not help. My back's broken, and several limbs too... You know you don't have long when the Bloodsuckers leave you alone...
Forgive me, Doctor. What happened to you?

It is difficult To me to speak... khe-khe-khe. Our expedition should reach to burner and investigate it... spits blood... Yes this France is able to insist... What was... khe-khe-khe... Mad idea, but he could persuade me and some others of the Board. Sakharov tried to dissuade us, but... Money... Spits and pants... A heap of money spent in this project and pride... Rattles, eyes are closed
Yes you all in blood, give I though I will try to stop blood
Already... Pants... Not help... Shoot down... Shoot down me
I should ask
I Beg... Stop... Stop these... khe-khe I can not... Kill me
Greetings, Zahar, is a pity Dan
It here has left one bag, PDA Tirana, speak it to you is necessary?
Yes the informant asked to extract for it
Well so drive 30,000 and it yours
Costly? certainly, well all right hold
Lines I without money will approach today later
Greetings, Zahar, yes here took the order From Dan and he has died
You about the helmet? Yes give I calculate. Yes, Arhara asked to come to it
Greetings... has found for Dan a flash card, and... In general of that to do I do not know
Let me give it a go... Ah, I see... There, Marked One, one calibrated helmet...
Greetings, my brother...
What's wrong?
In that bunker lies someone I tried to help. A scientist, who told me that they tried to disable the Scorcher, but it got them first...

And you believed him? You know why they were here? They were searching for LeHavre. They heard he knew of a secret pass to the Monolith from here, which would have saved them having to pass through Pripyat. That place is swarming with Monolith, trying to stop anyone getting further. Everyone was looking for a way around them...
Maybe the guy just didn't know...
Well, very few people did. I heard talk of it occasionally, but never anything firm. And now you know everything about it that I do...
So you've no idea where to even start?

No, I looked everywhere. But your friend LeHavre certainly would have known. Go and talk to Freeman. I'm sure he'll have an idea. Most likely there'll be a blueprint, probably in the hands of the Mercs. Once you have it, come back and we'll talk further...
I'll do that. He owes me a favor anyway...
Hello, Freeman. Have you heard about LeHavre?
Yes, I have. The whole Zone knows about it...
Then we need to keep this between us. I've heard of a secret path to the Monolith from Radar, but to find it I'll need a blueprint. Any ideas?

Listen, Marked One. In my first meeting with DeJames I saw such a blueprint. I didn't know what it was, nor how important it could be, but I have a good memory, especially when it concerns visuals. Well, when you brought me my case, there weren't just my documents inside, but also some of DeJames. In them was a mention about such a blueprint, and a mercenary by the name of Tamaz. I understand he was one of LeHavre's foremen, and he and his men eliminated anyone who got in LeHavre's way. Recently I heard that some remnants of LeHavre's organization have gathered at the Dump. Most likely Tamaz will be there with his men, and if there's a blueprint then Tamaz should have it. I suggest you go there and check it out...
Okay, and if I find anything I'll bring it to you...
I found the blueprint. But there's something I don't understand...
Let me have a look. Ah, yes. I see what you mean... Look here, Marked One. Do you see this room with a switch? Well, find it, go downstairs, and see what's there...
Thank you, Freeman, has again gained, from me kickback. Well all I have run, have put much
Well, Ghost, you as always are right. I have found a secret passage

I and thought. Yes, Marked One, business to you is. It is necessary for me, that you have found rare enough Artefact. It is called 'Gold Chunk'. To find it is possible only near Chernobyl, most likely it is necessary to look in North Chernobyl (in a courtyard). Find me 10 pieces, and I will tell about one secret passage. North Chernobyl in the Sarcophagus and back. You will make?
'Gold Chunk' you tell, all right I will look
Hi, Ghost. I have your Gold Chunks...

All of them? Well done and thank you, my friend. These will help me significantly. While you were away I worked out the coordinates of a transition from Chernobyl North to the Sarcophagus, and sent them to your PDA. Also, you should now be able to get straight to the Sarcophagus from here, inside X-10...
So, is that everything done? Are you free to leave here?

Unfortunately, not yet, as I have one more task for you. Did you ever hear of the Monolithian who looks after their records? Unbelievable, eh? But it's true, and who wouldn't want to get their hands on them? Not just notes on Monolith, but everything on Chernobyl since the accident, including the secret labs and their connection with the Wish Granter!\nWell, since the Brain Scorcher was shut down, more and more soldiers are being landed en route to Chernobyl by air, and this has really got Monolith mobilized. Somehow they're sending mutants to the south to block the way, but at some point their scribe got caught out in the open, and hid away his diaries in case he was killed or captured. My guys were watching from a distance, and told me about the three areas where he stopped. I'll tell you now that they won't be easy to spot, so you'll need to look around. There'll also be a shitload of mutants looking for their next meal, so be careful\nBut with these diaries we'll know so much more about the Monolith, which is why you're the only one I trust to go after them...
Don't worry, I'll get them for you. We need you back out in the field...
Well, they're not Strugatsky, but this is some of the best info on the Zone I've read in a long time...
Thank you, my friend. I knew I could trust you. And now, we can move on with our work. Good luck to you, my brother!

Dan's list:
 
9x19 armor-piercing cartridges, for three Flesh eyes
 
11.43x23 armor-piercing cartridges, for five Tushkano heads
 
5.45x39 armor-piercing cartridges, for four Controller hands

Dan's offers:
 
40 MIL PDAs will get you some specialized repair work done...
 
Three Blind Dog tails will get you either 5.45x39 or 5.56x45 ammo, or something special, like four packs of 9 x 18mm +P+, or four packs of 16 x 70 birdshot; but six Wild Boar hooves will earn you a valuable artefact...
Hello, who are you guys?
Hello, Marked One. We're from the group known as 'Clear Sky', and we control this territory...
I understand...

Though this swampland is considered ours, several key points are held by capable groups of bandits. I sent one of my men to observe their camp nearby, but he's not returned. I fear he has been captured or maybe even killed. The men believe that our man is still alive and want to make a rescue attempt. As you can see we are few in number, and I have a twisted ankle and can't lead the attack. You're an obviously skilled Stalker, so if you will lead this attack, I'll be in your debt...
I'll gladly help you, but can you spare any ammo or medkits?
We don't have enough medkits, but you can take this ammo...
Thanks. I can use all the ammo I can get...
Here, take this, and good luck to you guys...
Are you okay?
Yes. I'm a little beat up, but nothing's broken...
How did you get captured?

I was watching the bandit camp and nothing was really happening so I decided to wash my socks. I put my weapon down and started cleaning when I heard a Bloodsucker roar. It was after me so I ran, and in my panic I ran into this base, and became a captive. The bandits were howling with laughter at me. It was quite humiliating...
Yes, well we need to get out of here before any more bandits arrive...
I got your man out. He's safe now...
Here, thanks. Listen, if you go to our main base, please don't mention this...
And where's your base?

It's not too far from here. You go on a straight line past the church, then past a tower, and then you'll see our outpost in a small farm. Behind that is a portal - it'll take you to our base. Wait, I'll put an approximate location of the farm onto your PDA...
I understand. Thanks. Did you have anything for me?
Sorry, I'd nearly forgotten. Here you go...
What's going on?
Another vermin caught in the trap. Do you really think you can just walk in anywhere and take what you want?
I'm sorry, brother. In the Zone practically every house is ownerless, and you take anything useful to avoid it being wasted. If I'd known this place was occupied, I wouldn't have touched anything...
This stinking bog has become infested with thieves. You can't turn your back for a minute!
Brother, please listen! I'm no thief. What do I have to do to prove it to you?
You're going to have to do a job for us! Or become frog food...
What job are you talking about?
Nearby is an artefact container. We need you to retrieve it for us...
So what's the problem? Bloodsuckers, Zombies, or anomalies?
Nothing dangerous. An anomaly has formed a portal around the container. We just need you to find a way to get it...
How will I find a way?
You'll need to figure it out. Prove your commitment...
Okay. But can you spare any cartridges or medkits?
I won't go, sorry
Okay, then...
That was a little tricky, but here's your container...
I didn't expect you to return. I thought you'd run away
I told you I was no thief. I hope you believe me now...
Yes, I believe you. Here, this has all been a misunderstanding...
Why do you live here, amidst the swamps?

Why? I grew up not far from here. When all this madness, called the Zone, began I was conscripted into a local protection group. I had not long been married and was expecting my first-born. I was stationed on the perimeter, the Zone wasn't as large then. And here it comes... The letter, my wife has radiation sickness. My village was lied to by the government who told them it was safe to stay there. I have to go and see my wife, but the young officer denies my request. I lost my mind and grabbed my weapon and shot down all who tried to stop me. I walked into the hospital with my clothes covered in blood, the AK-47 still shaking in my hands. There my Grandma sits, and I ask 'Where is my Katka?', and she points to the sign: Mortuary. I... I go in there, and there she lies... so beautiful...
Kalmyak, I am so sorry to hear this...

It was so quiet, and then, beside her, I found the baby. So small, pink cheeks, but determined eyes, like my Katka's. I held his lifeless body to my chest and just slumped into a corner and wept. I don't know for how long. The military police came to arrest me, and I didn't resist. I was taken back to the camp and locked in a cell...
Then what happened?

Next day a big group of mutants attacked our section of the perimeter and broke through the defence. Gunfire everywhere, screams and roars, panic everywhere. The guards had fled, leaving me to my fate. My comrade Fedor came to my rescue and shot the lock open. He handed me a weapon and told me to run. Since then the Zone has been my home, I have nothing to go back to. Here I make ointments out of mutant glands and local plants - their healing properties are amazing. If you ever need some, I trade for vodka or cigarette...s
Life has not been fair to you, Kalmyak. The truth is, that's what brought me to your camp - to buy ointment to help someone...
I won't tell you the recipe. Just that it reduces radiation and stops bleeding...
Greetings, Kalmyak. I've come for some ointment...
You have vodka or cigarettes? Remember, for one jar of ointment - three bottles of vodka, or three packs of cigarettes...
Here are the cigarettes...
Here's your vodka...
Sorry, maybe next time...
Vasily, can you take a look at this?
It does need a little work...
Repair the first weapon
Repair the second weapon
Repair the outfit
Sorry, I don't have that kind of money...
Well here look as the newcomer
Why the hell do you even wear an outfit in this condition? I'll need to change all the armor plates...
It's quite good, I thank you
Now it's even better, than when it was new
Can you take a look at something else?
Yes please that there at us:
Oh! Are you related to Sidorovich?

Ah, so you're Marked One. Not the name you were born with, I'm sure, just as you can assume mine isn't Vasily. Listen - do you know the difference between a relative and a friend? You get to choose your friends... I've been in the Zone from the very beginning. Who do you think supplied the Scientists with their home comforts? Not the government, that's for certain! Do you know who was the first to supply arms in the Zone? Me, that's who! I was the first trader who could organize deliveries of everything - protection, weapons, and medicines. Yes, the one you call the Barman was my assistant, and every piece of business with every fighter in the Zone passed through us. We got them everything they needed, without government intervention. And then that bastard Sidorovich came along and did a deal with the military commanders - he even bargained with animals like Borov - and after that we were hounded and forced out of everything. He even took over my bunker in the Cordon... I swear that one day I will feed him to the Svatalka outside... I'm still alive though, much to his annoyance, but his reach doesn't extend to out here, where kind people live and work. I've survived, though I have a bad limp from a bullet wound. One day, though, the Zone will balance out everything, and our roles will be reversed!
Vasily, that is some story, and I didn't mean any disrespect. I'd like to do business with you. Do you service equipment?
Yes, this is my workshop, but I can't get anything done in my current condition...
Why? What's wrong?
My foot aches, especially at night. The wound isn't healing, and I'm in so much pain I can't sleep for more than a few minutes at a time... I really feel like shit...
Is there any way I can help?

Yes, there's a local man, Kalmyak, who makes these special ointments. I've had some from him before, and it helped me considerably, but now I can barely walk up and down the steps each day, let alone make the trip to see him...
Look, I'll go and get the ointments for you...
Well, if you could get me three jars then I could start working again...
Greetings, Vasily. Are you ready to dance?
Fuck off, Marked One. I can't even stand...
Vasily, I'm serious. I brought you your three jars...
Marked One, from this moment on you will be my most preferred client. Meaning that I'll always look after you...
Hello, Clerik. What's wrong?

Five years ago I found I had an ulcer, but I never got it treated. I just took something for the pain, and ignored it. But over the last couple of months it's become unbearable. Kalmyak gave me some ointment, but it doesn't seem to work on ulcers...
What can I do to help?
Bring me a Soul artefact - it's a well-known cure for ulcers. In exchange I'll give you Kalmyak's special ointment...
Okay, I'll try to help...
Clerik, do you remember our arrangement?
You mean about the ointment? Yes, of course I do. You have the artefact?
Here it is...
Wow, thanks. Here's three jars of ointment for you...
Hello, are you the leader of this faction?
Well, I have been for the last six months. We're the 'Clear Sky' faction. We study the Zone, but not like other scientists. Our involvement is different, and we have a different vision for its future
In what way are you different? As I see it, the only problems the Zone poses to mankind are due to scientists messing with it...

Yes, maybe the majority, but not all. There are always fanatics whenever anything new comes along, and here we have the Monolith. There are others, too, whose intentions are unclear... But we are not fanatics. We don't pray to anyone or anything, and we haven't come here to get rich. We love studying the Zone, but we don't answer to any goverment or sponsor. That's the main difference, which works to our advantage, but is also a disadvantage...
So you have little faith in the people in power?

Yes, but we're ready to co-operate with them, if they have the right intentions. But I think their scientific research is still focused on producing cheap power, and new weapons of mass destruction. That's what we're most concerned about. In a Zone full of horrific mutants and deadly anomalies, the most dangerous is still Man...
So you don't communicate with the scientists in any way?

Why should we? We maintain informal contact with some of the more sympathetic scientists, like Professor Kruglov, who helps us out occasionally. We're not rich, and we certainly don't have government-funded equipment, so we do mostly field work. Whenever we need a real laboratory, we contact the scientists and share our findings with them. Are you interested in helping us out, doing work to further our research?
What kind of work?
Well, we've been observing a mutation among a certain species of mutant. We'd like to know how it's connected with changes in the Zone, but we don't have any specimens for research...
What kind of mutant are you talking about?
In the northwest of the Swamps we found a different type of controller. We need to examine its brain, so I'm sure you understand what needs to be done...
Yuck, but if it's for Science, give me the data and I'll go and search...
I brought the controller's brain. Do you want to see it or shall I leave it somewhere?
Let's take a look... Yes, an unusual specimen. Much larger than usual...
That's the job done, but I forgot to ask - does work get paid for around here?
Oh, yes, of course! Here, take this. And if you come across any unusual mutant parts, I'll gladly buy them from you, although we usually pay in weapons and artefacts...
I found something that might interest you...
Let's see what you have...
A pair of red Bloodsucker tentacles...
A red Burer's hand...
I'm sorry, I thought I had something...
Hmm, an unusual specimen indeed. Here, please accept this in exchange...
Oh, this is the first time I've seen one of these. Here, please take this in exchange...
Sviblov, what's on your mind?
I want to start sending the men on regular patrols, but we lack the firepower to deal with large mutants
Do you have any ideas?

I do know where there is a PKM heavy machine gun. When my men patrolled near the abandoned farm the bandits, who have recently occupied the place, opened fire on them with the weapon. We are not as strong as we were before our unsuccessful attempt to break through to the Zone center. We lost our founder, Lebedev, and the majority of our veterans in that operation. Bandits have taken advantage of our weakness and control key points in the marsh. We somehow manage to hold this base and the approaches, also the 'Hunters' have helped us. If you can steal this machine gun it well help solve our problems. But I need you to do it with stealth
So you suggest I remain unseen?
I have no love for bloodshed, we only use our weapons as a last resort. So try to get it without being noticed. One of my men already waits for you, talk with him. he will tell you all the details
Greetings, how are you doing?

Greetings. You were sent by Sviblov? Good. There are seven in there - four outside and three in the building. You'll need to make your way inside, then look for a stash bag. That's where the weapon will be. Remember, no trouble, okay? We don't want to start a war...
You're not going with me?
No. Together, we'd make too much noise...
Okay, then wait for me here...
I brought the weapon
What happened?
Things didn't go quite as planned. During the most interesting moment 'Hunters' arrived and a gunfight ensued. But I managed to get the machine gun
I'm glad you were successful and came back unharmed. Here, take this as a gift
Can I help you?
Yes, I wanted to ask if you have seen any Monolithians? I mean here, in the Swamps...
As far as I know, there aren't any here. Bandits certainly, but not Monoliith...
We have evidence that they are here, but don't know how they're infiltrating. They don't usually poke their nose south of the Radar. This really troubles me, these fanatics are devils
What do you think they are up to??
With these brainless fanatics anything's possible. They didn't come here for artefacts, that's for sure. Listen, there's a man I'd like you to meet...
Who?, tell me about him first

His name is Cat, a smart guy who likes to keep a low profile. Former KGB. He said he found something, but I didn't press him for details. You should go and see what he's found. I'll put his location in your PDA...
Hello, are you Cat?
Yes I'm Cat, has Dan sent you? I asked him to find someone with a bit of common sense, and he sends a rookie
Watch your mouth! If you want to keep your teeth!
Woah...camn down... sorry, I've been waiting here for Dan to send some help. I hope your ready to deal with a dose of high radiation
What are you talking about?

Dan spoke to you about the Monolithians? I was the first to have noticed something was wrong. The Monolith have become more active. At first they were sighted on the Agroprom, then I personally saw them in the Dark Valley. I've also tracked them directly to the Radar, I had to abort that recon operation as I got a bad case of radiation sickness. I was not ready for such a campaign. Since then my health has failed. Now I have seen them here, one of them has died in a highly radioactive Zone. We need to search the corpse for some information. Believe me, if these fanatics have conceived something, things could end badly for all of us
Why should I believe anything you say, you agents leave a trail of innocent bodies wherever you go. I think I should rise and leave or first put a bullet in your forehead

You are right, I served in the KGB. Enough bad things have happened to me. I had to disappear and where else better than the Zone. The only thing waiting for me out in the world is a bullet in the temple, or cyanide in my coffee, it all depends on the imagination of my 'friends'. The Zone is my home now, so that's why I want to find out what the Monolith are up to
Well, let's assume I believe you. What's next?

Well first of all we need to examine that body. I was observing the 3 Monolithians marking a map. They went in different directions, I followed one. He went through a radioactive Zone and was quickly overcome and collapsed. Like I already explained before I would go myself but for me it's certain death. My system just cant handle the trauma yet and I would be dead in minutes
Alright, show me the place
Let's go, only take your time, it's difficult for me to walk quickly. I will take you to the place, there will be a ruined house, in the ruins look for a corpse
Here Cat, I found a map
Let me see that. So it's a map of the bogs. Strange, I don't understand what they were doing. What are these marks for?
Well so?

They have marked here one place, one more place in the southwest, here are figures, here are measurements - height, width and length. And here the rest... Alright, I now go to the bar at camp 'Clear Sky' to think about what we should do. Let's go, we will settle our affairs there
Well, Cat, have you received medical treatment?
Yes, but here only Vodka rescues. You know that radiation influences the brain, earlier I would have quickly worked out those plans you found. Now my brain is constantly clouded with fog
So, what will we do?
Well, actually, what we need to do is find the other two Monolithians, probably we can learn more from them
How will we find them?

Here on base 'Clear sky' they have the equipment that might help us find the remaining Monolithians. Go to the communications room and ask the officer if he can locate them, probably, they will be on their own network signal. When you find them, bring me any information you find and we will analyze it together
Welcome, what is it you want?
I need to find two people. Can you help?
Who do you want to find?
Two Monolithians spotted in this area. I have a Monolith PDA. Can you trace the signal to the others?
Very likely, but may I ask a favor in return?
Sure. What do you need?
I had a working TV, until it got knocked off the desk and the tube imploded. Could you get me another TV?
Actually, I believe I can. Do you need anything else to find these guys?
No. I've done it before, so it shouldn't be a problem. I'll set it up, and get the approximate coordinates ready for you...
Okay, I'll be back as soon as I can...
Well, did you find one?
Yes, here it is. Not new, of course, but at least it's working...

Thank you very much. Now, let's get you those coordinates. The problem here, at the periphery of the Zone, is weak signals. Also, these guys move around, so I've got it down to five possible areas, and I can't be more precise than that. I've sent them to your PDA. Unless they've left the Swamps, they'll be in one of those five places, so be careful...
Well, that's a lot easier than the alternative. Thanks for your help...
Hello Cat. I found a notebook on one of the Monolithians
This is interesting, very interesting. They are planning to construct something, but I can't tell what it is yet
What's next?
I need to study these notes some more. I'm sure you have other affairs to attend to, so do you know the '100 Rads' bar? I'll meet you there later and we'll discuss this further...
Greetings...
Greetings wanderer. Stop a while. We're always glad to see good people...
I'm tired. It's a long journey to reach your camp. What's that smell? Is something burning?
Dammit! I've burnt it again... What am I going to feed the men now?
That's quite a stench... What were you cooking?

Our brothers brought in a wild boar, but the meat's tough and stinks when you fry it. The best meat comes from the Pseudogiant. Tastes sort of like chicken, but a hundred times better. Hey, are you looking for work?
What kind of work?
It's not a dirty job, but you'll need to run around a bit...
You want me to hunt something?

I don't want you to kill anything. A few days ago some of the men saw a 'Red Pseudogiant' at Agroprom. These are very rare, and their meat... I tell you... even at the best restaurant in Moscow you wouldn't get anything as delicious...
Surely you don't want me to bring it back alive?

No, I want you to mark it with this special rifle that shoots a hypodermic micro-transmitter. Then we'll send out a hunting party, as it'll need several men to carry that much meat. So, just mark the Red Pseudogiant and don't kill it. Then return here with the rifle...
I hope the job will pay well...
Don't worry about that. Just take care not to kill him - the thought of that succulent meat rotting away brings tears to my eyes...
Greetings, Barman
Greetings, my friend! I can see the location of the Red Pseudogiant on my PDA. I've already informed Dan, so we're looking forward to a good breakfast and supper for several days...
Sounds better than stale bread and sausage. You mentioned payment?
Oh, yes, certainly. Here you are...
Hello, brother. Who are you?
Borman is my name. How did you reach here by yourself? Even groups of five rarely reach this far north...
I tend to use paths not frequented by many Stalkers...
Regardless of that, if you reached Limansk you must be very skilled indeed. We could really use your help here, brother...
Whats going on?

Here's the situation, we hold this side of the bridge and the Monolithians hold the other side. As you can see, the situation is far from stable, and these damn mutants and zombies just keep appearing. Our main problem is this Monolith sniper, the former marksman from Voroshilovsky. The bastard picks off one or two of my men each day. Do you think you can take him out?
Are you offering a reward for his head, then?
Well, brother, I've got ten packs of assorted cartridges I can give you...
That'll do. Let me try...
Greetings, Borman...
You never cease to surprise me, Marked One. How did your adventure go?
Let's just say that your problems have been reduced by one...
Thank you, brother. You've saved many lives by ridding us of that bastard... Here, take these as I promised
Is there anything else you need?
Yes, again your help is needed. Here, the Monolithians jam our radio signals, so we can't communicate with anyone...
Well, I'm not a radio engineer, so what good can I do?

No, all you need to do to start with is find the jammer they're using, and remove it. But the next part should be fun, because we're going to take it to Miser, and he'll recalibrate it so that it jams the Monolithians' radio signals instead. So, borrow their jammer, take it to Miser, then put it back where you found it. That should fuck the bastards up for a while...
He, good plan, but where do I find the jammer?

It's got to be up high, so probably somewhere around the construction building on the hill. It'll also need to be somewhere out of the rain. Sorry I can't be more precise than that. I'm afraid we're in short supply of everything out here, but I promise we'll find a way to reward you...
Don't worry about it, Borman. Let's fuck up the Monolith, shall we?
Greetings, Miser...
My old friend, why have you come? To buy something?
I'm here on business for Borman. Do you already know the situation?
Yes, you mean the jammer?
Here it is, a heavy lump of steel
This will take me about five hours to adjust, come back then
Well, is the jammer ready?
You're too early. I said I needed five hours...
Miser, is the jammer ready?
It's ready. Now let the Monolithians get a taste of their own technology... Take it back to exactly where you found it, and send my greetings to Borman...
It's done brother. The jammer's in place
You have gained many friends
Glad to help, and greetings to you from the Miser...
Here, please take this as promised. Oh, and I got a message from Sviblov in the Swamps. He needs to talk to you..
Cat, what's wrong? You look terrible...
I'm not what you'd call 'in good shape'. I think I'll be dead soon, and that's no joke...
Can I help?
I need something to extract this radiation poison from my bones. I've heard that Kalmyak makes such a medicine...
Do you mean his ointment?
No, there's another remedy Kalmyak makes, but I don't think he'd make it for me. I know he was friends with Victor Hologram, so he may be able to help, but I'd never make it there...
They have Antirads here. That should reduce the radiation, surely...
I'm afraid my condition is too far advanced for standard Antirads. I need something much stronger, that'll go deep into the marrow. I'd go for it myself, but I just don't have the strength...
Don't worry, Cat. You stay here. I'll find you the medicine, whatever it takes...
What should I ask for?
If you tell him what it's for, Kalmyak will know...
Okay, I'm going now...
Greetings, Kalmyak...
Hello, have you come for some ointment?
Actually, I've come for medicine - something special that only you can make. Do you know Cat? He has advanced radiation sickness that just gets worse each day...
Cat? That bastard who used to be known as Feral Cat? Do you know his past? How much innocent blood he's responsible for? I'm glad it's finally his turn...
Brother, please do it for me. I need his help finding out what the Monolithians are doing in the Swamps...
Shit! If anyone else had asked me... Well, only for your sake, and my brothers in the Swamps. But this medicine requires ingredients I can't get here...
What do you need?

I need ten Snork feet and a Night Star artefact'. Everything else, I have. But there's one condition - the medicine goes off quickly, and it has to be prepared in the early hours before dawn. So after you bring me the ingredients you'll have until 5.00 am to pick up the medicine. If you don't come at this time, then we'll need to start again next day. Got it?
Got it. I'll find the parts for you...
Greetings, Kalmyak. Here are the parts you need...

Okay, let's have them. I need time to prepare the medicine, so go and take care of other matters. Just be back here before five in the morning, but please don't hang around here because I need to work in peace...
Is the medicine ready?
No, you're too early. It's not ready yet...
Hi Kalmyak. I hope I'm not disturbing you. Have you finished the job?
Here, it's ready. It's very radioactive, so I hope you've got artefacts or Antirads to counter it during transportation...
Cat... Here, take this as soon as possible
Take what?
I brought your medicine from Kalmyak. Take it

He made it for me? I never thought... Thanks, Marked One. You've saved my life. Here, it's not much, but please accept this suit. It's been specially strengthened against mutant attacks. It's yours...
Here, Cat. Take this...
You brought it?
Kalmyak says you might spit a little blood for a while, but that's normal...

He made it for me? I never thought... Thanks, Marked One. You've saved my life. Here, it's not much, but please accept this suit. It's been specially strengthened against mutant attacks. It's yours...
Hello...
Are you sick, or have you just here for a rest? The accommodation here is modest, but we're always glad to have visitors...
I heard you're on good terms with Kalmyak?
Yes, but not that good. Sometimes he came here to drink, sometimes to get drunk. When he did he'd share some recipes with me, about medicines to reduce radiation...
Listen, could you give me this medicine? I need it to help someone...
Well, I'll do what I can, but please understand that we're poor people...
What do you need?
A Simbion artefact. Cold at Clear Sky needs one...
I'll try to get one for you...
Hello, Cold. I have something for you...
Yes! A real Simbion! Thank you for your help...
No problem brother. Hey, I need some medicine...
Ah, yes. I've had a message to have it ready for you. Here...
I'd like to trade...
I have medkits and F-1 grenades
What do you want?
I'll trade you four F-1 grenades for either a Gravi, a Meat Chunk, or two Quirks\nI'll trade you five medkits for either a Slug, two Sparklers, or two Stone Bloods...
Here's a Gravi. Four grenades, please...
Grenades, please. Here's a Meat Chunk...
Grenades, please. Here are two Quirks...
Here's a Slug. Five medkits, please...
Medkits, please. Here are two Sparklers...
Medkits, please. Here are two Stone Bloods...
Sorry, I don't have those artefacts...
Is there still a job?
Considering your reputation, this task should put a smile on your face...
What needs to be done?

We lack heavy weapons, therefore we had to do some trading with Mercenaries. One of my men, 'Freebie', has been telling me he can get everything we need. He has set up a meeting with the Mercenaries, about arms supplies. But they have made a condition that, from our party, only two persons can attend. We have dealt with them in the past and they have not always been fair. Therefore I'd like to ask you to 'observe' the transaction. To me the most important thing is 'Freebie' stays alive, and gets the weapon. From the very beginning I was against this transaction, but 'Freebie' insists that it's a sure deal...
So to recap, I should cover Freebie while he makes the deal?

Yes, that's right. 'Freebie' should not die, and the second condition - we don't want to be seen as violating the agreement, so you should remain unseen by the Mercenaries. The transaction will occur on an abandoned farm in the Cordon
I understand. I'll keep quiet...

A group of Monolithians have been spotted at Agroprom. We need to find them, and what they're up to. We don't have enough information...
